title: Ticket #5100: condor_off -peaceful doesn't work well with DAGs
description:
If you do 'condor_off -peaceful' on a machine that has a running DAG, the HTCondor daemons will most likely never actually stop. The problem is that DAGMan is running, and unless you manage to happen to do the condor_off at a point where DAGMan will eventually quit when the running jobs finish, it will stay in the running state indefinitely.

You can work around this by doing a condor_hold on DAGMan, so maybe 'condor_off -peaceful' should hold any scheduler-universe jobs (or condor_dagman jobs, anyhow)?
